stadium.name: Fletchings Field
stadium.description: Fletchings Field was the first formal Troll Ball stadium in Warden lands. The design balances wood and stone, with arrowhead motifs and banners representing each region under Warden protection. The field includes trees, gully's and other obstacle placements, changed each match by local druids and terrain crafters.

stats.pregame_ritual: Going over the game plan drawn in the dirt with the team captain.
Leading the team in a synchronized chant that slowly gets louder.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Wearing their boots on the wrong feet during the warm-up.
Giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before each game.
Headbutting their own team's goal post (gently).
Sticking a specific type of feather in their helmet's plume.
Burying their helmet in the ground and then digging it back up.
Reading their own fortune in a scattering of knuckle bones.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Always putting on their left gauntlet before their right.

stadium.name: The South Pole Palisade
stadium.description: A crude, fortified playing field built from rough-hewn logs. It's less a stadium and more a stockade against the wilderness. The 'grass' is mostly frozen mud and straw.

stats.pregame_ritual: Smelling their own game-worn socks from the previous match.
Braiding their hair into tight, battle-ready rows.
Listening to the wind for a sign of which way the game will turn.
Getting a teammate to punch them in the shoulder, hard.
Wearing a specific, garishly colored pair of undergarments.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Polishing their boots with bacon grease.
Clapping their hands a prime number of times.
Reciting a short, epic poem about a past victory.
Turning their helmet around three times before putting it on.
Licking a whetstone.

preGame:
Hello, hello, HELLO, you beautiful brutes and brawlers, and welcome to another spectacular Tuesday Night Trollball! This is your favorite demonic host, Nok the Corrupter, coming to you live with a matchup that's sure to be a bone-crunching classic! üéôÔ∏è Tonight, the rugged challengers from the frontier, The South Pole Yetis, march into the manicured wilderness of Fletchings Field to take on the hometown heroes, Oak & Onslaught!

The Yetis are a tough bunch, hardened by the freezing rain and wolf packs of their home Palisade. They get ready for war in the most authentic ways! Their healer, Seiter Aida, gets in the zone by smelling their own game-worn socks! Now that‚Äôs dedication to the funk of war! Meanwhile, Isborne Krause asks a teammate to punch him square in the shoulder, and Udela Dorkus sharpens their wits by LICKING A WHETSTONE! My kind of people! ‚ùÑÔ∏è

And in the other corner, we have Oak & Onslaught, the pride of the Wardens. They‚Äôre a bit more... theatrical. Player Symer Crissy prepares by giving the Trollball a heroic backstory before the game. Oh, brother! I bet it's some drivel about how the ball is on a noble quest, probably inspired by that blowhard Artorias. Others, like Wynnie Faina, get ready by wearing their boots on the wrong feet. A strange tactic, but who am I to question what works? They'll need more than misplaced footwear to handle the raw power of the Yetis!

It's the wild frontier versus the curated forest! It‚Äôs bacon-greased boots versus heroic fables! The druids have shifted the terrain, the players are hungry for violence, and I am ready for the CRACK of armor and the cheer of the crowd! So grab your grog, place your bets (not with Yarp, he still won't take my business), and settle in! This is going to be a glorious mess! LET‚ÄôS PLAY TROLLBALL! üí•
postGame:
### A Defensive Duel in Fletchings Field!

WHAT A GAME, FOLKS! That was a masterclass in pain and perseverance! If you love hard hits, frantic scrambles, and a score settled by a single, brilliant act of athletic artistry, then this was the match for you! The South Pole Yetis have done it, shutting out the hometown favorites in a stunning display of grit!

### First Half: The Meat Grinder

The first half was pure, unadulterated carnage, just the way I like it. The ball barely had time to rest! Oak & Onslaught's Affra Yanaton picked it up first, but was immediately STUFFED by Sayers Erdda of the Yetis, who snatched the ball away. That set the tone for the entire half: every inch was fought for, every possession paid for in blood and bruises.

The field became a whirlwind of combat! We saw Milt Casady use his Blackjack to send Coussoule Bidle to the sidelines for a nap. But you can't keep a good brawler down! Bidle came back later and returned the favor, and then some, taking out Millham Evangeline and Hole Bowerman with his trusty mallet. It was a beautiful, violent ballet of retribution! üé≠

And the double knockouts! Oh, the glorious symmetry of mutual destruction! Sale Tocci and Abner Seidel faced off, Talwar against Talwar, and BOTH went down! Ajit Serge and Teria Ravo did the same with their War Picks! Then, just to prove it wasn't a fluke, Sale Tocci and Ema Ulrick took each other out of the game simultaneously! The healers on both sides were earning their pay, let me tell you!

Possession was a fleeting dream. Ema Ulrick made a fantastic run for Oak & Onslaught, slipping past one defender only to be walled off by the immovable Udela Dorkus, forcing a fumble. The ball was dropped, passed, fumbled, and fought over in a beautiful chaotic scrum that left bodies littering the field. By the time the halftime whistle blew, the score was still a stubborn 0-0. All violence, no score. Perfect!

### Second Half: A Shot in the Dark

After the healers worked their magic and scraped our warriors off the turf, the second half began with the same ferocious intensity. The Yetis' Ajit Serge immediately went for a long bomb, a speculative shot from center field! It fell short, but what a statement of intent! They weren't here to play patty-cake with Sir Randy and his Warden pals.

The brutal back-and-forth continued. Isborne Krause of the Yetis was a one-man wrecking crew, sending two of Oak & Onslaught's players to the healer's tent with his flail. The momentum seemed to be swinging, but every advance was met with a crushing counter-attack. The ball was a hot potato nobody could hold onto for long.

The turning point came from a spectacular defensive play. Oak & Onslaught's Millham Evangeline was making a break for it, but was stopped dead in their tracks by Selima Si, who not only blocked the run but TOOK THE BALL! A massive momentum shift for the visitors from the South Pole!

With the Yetis now on the attack deep in enemy territory, the tension was thick enough to chew! The ball found its way to Sayers Erdda, who had been a defensive powerhouse all game. They found a sliver of space in the two-point zone, took a deep breath, and let it fly! The Trollball sailed through the air, a perfect arc against the sky... AND IT'S GOOD! IT'S GOOD! üèÄ

### Final Whistle: Yetis Conquer!

With a 2-0 lead, the Yetis just had to hold on. Oak & Onslaught mounted a desperate final charge, but a fumbled catch sealed their fate. The clock ran out, and the victory belonged to the tough-as-nails travelers from the south!

**Your final score: The South Pole Yetis 2, Oak & Onslaught 0!**

An incredible victory for The South Pole Yetis, built on the back of a rock-solid defense and one moment of pure offensive genius from Sayers Erdda. They came into the Wardens' precious, shifting forest and showed them what real wilderness grit looks like! Maybe next time Oak & Onslaught should spend less time giving the ball a heroic backstory and more time practicing their catching! A truly magnificent game! Until next time, this is Nok the Corrupter, signing off! KEEP IT BRUTAL! ü§ò
